item.title: Installation
item.description: We will use Docker Desktop which is free for smaller companies and costs a small fee per developer for large companies.

item.title: Containers
item.description: A container is an “isolated process”, it’s easiest to just think of it as a VM.

item.title: Pods
item.description: In Kubernetes, a “Pod”1 is the smallest deployable unit possible. This is kind of an abstract description.

item.title: Deployment
item.description: Creating a pod is cool, but it’s not that different from just running the Docker container by hand.

item.title: Service
item.description: In Kubernetes the term “Service”1 is used for loadbalancers inside the cluster. In this section, we will explore how to communicate with multiple pods using these loadbalancers so you can communicate with any of pods through a single interface.
